thread.title: Feds launch raids in Orlando and across Florida in secret DoD probe – Orlando Sentinel
thread.title_full: Feds launch raids in Orlando and across Florida in secret DoD probe – Orlando Sentinel

author: Cristóbal Reyes
title: Feds launch raids in Orlando and across Florida in secret DoD probe – Orlando Sentinel
text:
News Crime and Public Safety SUBSCRIBER ONLY Feds launch raids in Orlando and across Florida in secret DoD probe One such search apparently hit an engineering contractor near the University of Central Florida Share this: Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Click to share on X (Opens in new window) Lights on a law enforcement vehicle. By Cristóbal Reyes | | Orlando Sentinel PUBLISHED: June 27, 2024 at 5:12 p.m. | UPDATED: June 27, 2024 at 5:13 p.m. Federal investigators searched multiple sites in Florida this week, including Orlando, in what appeared to be a series of raids connected to an unknown criminal investigation.
The searches, which took place Tuesday and confirmed Thursday by the Department of Defense’s Office of Inspector General, were led by the Defense Criminal Investigative Service and the Department of the Army Criminal Investigation Division, but it’s not clear exactly where the searches took place and why.
Helicopter footage by WFTV-Channel 9 appeared to show a raid taking place at a building on Discovery Drive, near the University of Central Florida. The building houses Cole Engineering Services Inc., a contractor provides modeling and simulation training to the military.
Inspector General’s spokesperson Mollie Halpern declined to confirm what sites were searched, and declined to discuss Cole Engineering, citing an ongoing investigation. It’s not clear whether any arrests were made or if there are pending charges. A U.S. Army spokesperson also declined further comment.
A spokesperson for Cole Engineering did not immediately respond to a message seeking comment.
